attributes.action: On exit of EU, enact law to require rabies titer for dogs entering without owner
attributes.background: An estimated 30,000 dogs from the EU enter the UK each year as commercial imports. In 2013 the number was 1,869. The majority of dogs are "rescue dogs", up to 50 in a van, from Romania, Bosnia, Serbia & Bulgaria. Many with falsified passports and have not been vaccinated against rabies nor wormed.
attributes.additional_details: Barnaby's Law, is a campaign named after my dog, bought in the UK & now in quarantine. We're not against re-homing from EU but diseases we eradicated or never had are on the increase. A rabies titer test result, obtained before travel, should be required for all dogs not travelling on the pet passport scheme and within 5 days of their owner. To prevent the possibility of fake titer results,chip readers should be available for use at UK BIP's and the chip number checked against the FAVN database.

attributes.action: Make it law to scan microchips routinely on current & new patients at the vets.
attributes.background:
As the public & dog owners who see our dogs & cats as part of our family we would expect all vets to scan them. 
If a dog or cat goes missing and then found and kept by someone or is stolen and sold on they have little chance of ever being found & reunited with their family as most vets never scan
attributes.additional_details:
In reality if they were brought into a vets somewhere they're chip would definitely most likely not be checked. 
I have moved around the UK over the years & I have belonged to approx 11 different practices & not one offered to scan my dogs. I had to request it and luckily I did as 1 of my dogs chip had dissaperared. He is now chipped again to be safe. Scanning new & old patients microchips would reunite so many. It doesn't take long & reception staff could also easily do this. 

DogsAreFamily üíî

attributes.action: Increase the cycle to work scheme limit from ¬£1000 to ¬£2000.
attributes.background: Introduced in 1999, the scheme allows workers to buy a bike and accessories through their workplace. If the scheme‚Äôs limit had tracked inflation it would now be over ¬£1,600. In addition, e-bikes are now becoming popular, provide access to cycling to more people, but are even more expensive.
attributes.additional_details:
Some organisations have obtained permission from the FCA to provide loans to a higher limit, but many do not do this (e.g. due to the complexity of obtaining permission and costs).

This is a timely petition as officials from DfT, HMT and HMRC are reviewing the scheme‚Äôs guidance (including the limit) as part of the Government‚Äôs Cycling and Walking Investment Strategy.

Source of inflation data: https://www.bankofengland.co.uk/monetary-policy/inflation/inflation-calculator

attributes.action: Make the denial of genocide in Srebrenica illegal and subject to prosecution
attributes.background:
In July 1995, more than 8,373 Bosniaks, mainly men and boys were murdered in cold blood, in Srebrenica during the Bosnian War.
As this was a clear act of genocide, it should be illegal to deny this event ever happened.
attributes.additional_details:
The International Court of Justice (ICJ) ruled that the Srebrenica massacre was a genocide and was not just limited to men, but also to women and children, with the youngest victim being a newborn baby.
With human life being so precious, denial of their demise gives justification to the perpetrators of this heinous crime.

attributes.action: Reinstate Pension/Income Letters at Bangkok British Embassy
attributes.background:
As of the 12th of December 2018 British Citizens can no longer request a proof of income letter required to obtain a Retirement or Extension based on marriage visa in Thailand

Other Countries Embassy's have an option to sign an affidavit that your income is true.
attributes.additional_details:
The British Embassy has stated that this is because the Thai Immigration require proof that they cannot provide yet the current income letter already covers the embassy legally.  

The British Embassy has left us to resolve this with Thai immigration

The Thai immigration has not made any announcement and still requests the letter. Failing this retired or married Brits may be forced to transfer between ¬£9-18,000 to a Thai bank as proof

attributes.action: Equality for gay men giving blood
attributes.background: I was going to join the blood donation club today. I was feeling rather heroic knowing my blood would be used to help save lives. Because I am a gay man in a four-year relationship, I was told that I wouldn‚Äôt be eligible to donate.
attributes.additional_details: I have to stay celibate for a minimum of 3 months in order to qualify.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for cycle races/time trials to race on open, public ways/roads.
attributes.background:
Cycle racing/time trials on open/public roads need to be reviewed. Cycles are getting faster, meaning more danger to other road users, pedestrians etc and roads are getting busier with more cars than ever.

Cycle races/time trials should now only be held on closed ways/roads.
attributes.additional_details:
"A person who promotes or takes part in a race or trial of speed between motor vehicles on a public way is guilty of an offence."

This should include cyclists. Cycles are faster and more streamlined than they have ever been for general road use, so races/time trials on public ways are faster than they have ever been and therefore more dangerous an should be illegal. A cycle can go faster than a 50cc moped but it is illegal to race a moped, but not a cycle.

This needs seriously reviewing.

attributes.action: Diagnosed mental health patients should receive free prescriptions
attributes.background: Without medication mental health patients can die, they are three times more likely to develop additional physical problems such as diabetes, heart disease and addictions, all of which can reduce life expectancy.
attributes.additional_details:
Mental illness is considered a disability, question behaviour, whether stable and/or taking medication. 
Mind organisation have already researched the definition and terms of disability in conjunction with the Equality Act, 2010. Mental health is included. 
Diagnosed mental health problems should qualify an individual for free prescriptions in the same way as some medical conditions and physical disabilities.

attributes.action: Pass a law to prevent landlords refusing people to have pets.
attributes.background: We request you pass a law that forbids landlords to deny tenants a pet as it will prove beneficial for people and animals alike.
attributes.additional_details: Having pets has been proved to be very beneficial for health, lowering blood pressure, helping with stress etc. For people living alone they are companionship. For children, it educates them about caring and having compassion for other living creatures along with responsibility of such. With so many animal shelters full, the problem is being exhasperated by private landlords denying people a basic right to have a pet. For time immemorial people have kept animals as pets and surely it is within their human rights to do so.

attributes.action: Scrap the ¬£500 deposit to run for parliament
attributes.background: The deposit is unreasonable as it depends on financial means. The ability to pay a specified fee is not a relevant or appropriate criterion for determining access to the ballot paper. There should never be an ‚Äòentrance fee‚Äô to democracy, the democratic process should be open to all.
attributes.additional_details:
The deposit of ¬£500 is returned if the candidate gets 5% of the vote - with low turnouts at elections due to voter apathy , this is a tall order for the minor parties and independents. This in turn puts those candidates in a position where they are forced to consider finances before partaking in the democratic right to stand for election . 
Lost deposits go to the Treasury's Consolidated Fund, which is effectively the government's current account-that‚Äôs why I call it a ‚ÄòTax on Democracy'.

attributes.action: Make retailers that sell drinks sell at least 30% of them in non plastic.
attributes.background:
Plastic is causing catastrophic effects in the environment we all live in. 
So why do many large, and small High Street retailers still sell ONLY plastic bottles of drinks? 
If there is a choice, people will be able to choose to not have plastic. The % should increase 10% each year for 4 years.
attributes.additional_details:
In our local NHS hospital a large multinational retailer only sells plastic bottled drinks.
A local chain of bakeries only sells drinks in plastic bottles.
There is already too much recyclable plastic that isn't recycled in the world. Drinks bottles use New plastic, not recycled plastic. Cutting down on New plastic for these drinks bottles will cut down the plastic that will then enter into the environment. 
Quicker, and easier to implement that a plastic bottle refund scheme.

attributes.action: Exempt the use of a knife from self-defence and reasonable force.
attributes.background: When someone stabs another unarmed person who is not carrying a knife, they should not be able to claim self-defence. For example, when someone is punched and they respond by stabbing the other to death with a knife.
attributes.additional_details:
Anyone that goes out on the streets in a public place carrying a knife, should not be allowed to claim they used the knife in self-defence whether someone punches them or shouts at them or throws something at them. 

People are being acquitted even when the other person is unarmed and not carrying a knife. 

The law needs to change. If you go out with a knife it should be presumed that you do so with the intention to use it. No-one should be allowed to say they carry for protection.

attributes.action: Award a campaign medal to those who fought in France & Norway between 1939-40.
attributes.background: There have been medals awarded for most of the major campaigns of WW2 however one glaring omission has been a recognition of those who fought the Nazis in France and Norway period 1939-40. Many of these soldiers became POWs and endured many years suffering with no recognition for their sacrifice.
attributes.additional_details: A new campaign medal to retrospectively recognise the sacrifices of those who served in various theatres of WW2 is not without precedent - a Bomber Command clasp and Arctic Convoy medal have both been created in recent years. Thousands of men fought in Norway and in the desperate rearguard action in France in an attempt to halt the Nazi war machine including almost the entire 51st Highland Division. Their courage in the face of the enemy and fortitude as POWs deserves recognition.

attributes.action: Protect the welfare of small animals by banning their sale from retail outlets
attributes.background: Despite the requirement to be licensed by the local authority, pets for sale in large stores are kept in conditions that frequently do not meet RSPCA minimum welfare standards. Many are bought on a whim,or without prior research in to their ongoing care.Most end up in rescue or abandoned
attributes.additional_details: In 2018, why is there the need to purchase pets from a shop? I would envisage the profit margin from such sales to be  minimal,the main income being from pet food and supplies, not to mention the dreadful hutches on sale that do not meet RSPCA minimum welfare standards?  Stressed rabbits are more likely to become ill.Bred for profit and kept in small glass cages, on sawdust, without their natural freedoms, their lethargy and distress is evident .Help me end this inhumane practise

attributes.action: Change how Universal Credit is calculated for those receiving student income
attributes.background: Currently student income is deducted pound for pound as though it‚Äôs unpaid income. It should be treated the same as earned income and deducted 63p in the pound. Calculations should also be changed for Scottish students who receive monthly student income payments and can have no payments over summer.
attributes.additional_details: Many lone parent students, indeed any student, can find themselves in a position where they are up to ¬£300 a month worse off under UC than under tax credits because of the current guidance on student income. We take out student loans out to fund our education to help us get to a position where we no longer require in work benefits and instead of being encouraged we are penalised. They don‚Äôt acknowledge bank loans as income so why are student loans deducted so harshly for calculation purposes!

attributes.action: Scrap the expansion plans for Heathrow Airport
attributes.background: More expansion for London, which the residents don't want. More pollution, years of misery on the M25, and wasting taxpayer money in an outdated hub-and-spoke airport operating model. The rest of the UK would love the chance to expand their infrastructure.
attributes.additional_details: East Midlands Airport in Leicestershire is the absolute logical choice for expanding the UK's network. It's got a HUGE runway (already handles 747s, A380s and An-124s), it's right next to the M42 (for M6) and M1, and it's on the route of HS2. If it has to be in London, then Gatwick is by far a more sensible option when you consider disruption, pollution, and cost.

attributes.action: Remove legal privilege from the PHSO so police can investigate misconduct
attributes.background: The Parliamentary and Health Service Ombudsman has legal privilege which means that the police cannot look at their case files to investigate allegations of staff misconduct in public office. The PHSO investigates the death of our loved ones but the police have never been able to intervene.
attributes.additional_details: The PSHO should not appear to be above the law. During the investigation into the death of my son, I believe that staff didn‚Äôt do their jobs correctly which led to a flawed report and decision. I‚Äôll never be able to know for sure however because the police are not able to investigate. This means I will  never know the truth behind my son‚Äôs death. This is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Demand a public inquiry into South Western Railway under MD Andy Mellors
attributes.background: As a commuter and regular user of South Western Railway I need answers from Westminster as to why privatized companies such as this can get away with such an increasingly appalling service!
attributes.additional_details:
Broken down train at Clapham Jct
on eve of 19/6/18 causing delays of over an hour to most of South East!
General daily failure of trains to leave at published times.

attributes.action: Recognise parental  alienation and make it a criminal offence.
attributes.background:
Parental Alienation
This can occur when a child is caught in between their parents divorce or separation, the offending parent deliberately turns their child against their ex so that they eventually cut off all contact. This can be described as one parent ‚Äòtrying to turn their child into a soldier.
attributes.additional_details: Anthony Douglas, the chief executive of Cafcass, vividly described it as one parent ‚Äòtrying to turn their child into a child soldier in a battle‚Äô. Previously parental alienation has been dismissed as a common product of bitterness about a failed relationship, but it is separate from these normal feelings of hurt. Parental alienation is in fact an internationally recognised form of parental psychological abuse and undermines the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and the UN Convention on the rights of the child. In Mexico and Brazil, it is even classed as a criminal offence.

attributes.action: Provide funding to Staffordshire County Council to reduce a ¬£35 million deficit
attributes.background: Staffordshire County Council has already slashed running costs by ¬£240 million in 9 years. There is a further forecast ¬£35 million reduction that will see much needed services for Staffordshire people reduced or even removed. Therefore we are asking the UK Government to provide adequate funding.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are just a few of the proposed cuts: 

‚Ä¢ School crossing patrols
‚Ä¢ Review cost of children‚Äôs resident provision
‚Ä¢ Review alternative autism funding
‚Ä¢ Review of Victoria Centre of history grant 
‚Ä¢ Removal of non-statutory community transport 
‚Ä¢ Removal of concessionary travel before 09.30 
‚Ä¢ Reduction in grants to voluntary community social enterprise
‚Ä¢ Review of Adult learning disability provisions to remove preventive services
‚Ä¢ Review remaining financial support for hate crime

attributes.action: To make all schools and nursery‚Äôs nut free environments
attributes.background: I have two young children both with serious nut allergies. One is at infant school and one is a toddler. There are not that many nurseries or schools with nut free policies and our children spend a lot of time in these environments and we need to be sure that they are in safe hands on a daily basis.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to vaccinate your children
attributes.background: Intentionally not vaccinating children, except in cases where there are health risks, should not be allowed. It increases the risks of infection to the child and to other children.
attributes.additional_details:
On the 20th August 2018 it was revealed by Public Health England that in the first half of 2018 there were over 800 cases of measles, almost four times as many as there were in the entirety of 2017. 

According to the NHS, 4 out of the 6 vaccinations given to 1 and 2 year olds showed decreases in immunisations which is a worrying development. 
 
France has already made immunizations a legal requirement.
 
Between 2004 and 2014 there were nearly 10,000 cases of Measles and over 81,000 cases of mumps

attributes.action: Require airlines to carry small pets in aircraft cabin on flights to the UK
attributes.background:
Ever tried going on holiday with your best friend? 
Unfortunately for pet owners that live in the UK the options are limited: 1. leave your dog in a kennel (If family/friends is not an option) 2. take your pet with you and return via ferry or car 3. ship your pet as cargo in the hold.
attributes.additional_details:
Putting a pet in cargo (if your pet is not snub nosed like mine) is very risky and traumatic, especially for long flights. For those with pets that comply with cabin regulations, it is simply unnecessary to either not be able to fly into Britain or have to leave a pet behind for an extended period of time. 
Why are we able to fly out with pets in cabin and not back into the UK? 
The British are among the biggest animal-lovers in the world. Let's make it easier to enjoy family holidays together!

attributes.action: Force providers to supply the free to air tv channels on bedside tv sets.
attributes.background: Charging hospital patients who have no other means of entertainment, a fee for supplying free to air tv channels should be stopped. It is unfair to charge anyone to watch free to air channels.

attributes.action: Award a separate medal to recognise the Bomb Disposal Service in WWII
attributes.background: A watercolour began my journey of discovery leading to the heroic acts by the artist Capt. John Hannaford & his colleagues. 350 men were killed defusing, clearing bombs, UXBs, over 50,000 across the UK. Many were killed clearing mines from our beaches. They deserve official recognition.
attributes.additional_details: Capt. Hannaford‚Äôs notes, photographs, his in-depth interview at 95 for the IWM with a Channel 4 documentary highlight his belief that the bomb disposal service men and women were forgotten. Footage included other WWII bomb disposal officers telling their heroic story and acts of courage of all their servicemen. Whilst researching I discovered the most powerful evidence was a quote from our great statesman Winston Churchill who said, "Bomb Disposal should be recognised for their dangerous work!"

attributes.action: Make Zoroastrianism a part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: Schools should teach pupils about Zoroastrianism. It is one of the world's oldest active religions. It is the first monotheistic faith centered in a cosmology of good and evil and an eschatology predicting the ultimate destruction of evil. Ascribed by Zarathustra who lived almost 3,500 years ago.
attributes.additional_details: Zoroastrianism enters recorded history in the 5th-century BCE. It served as the state religion of the pre-Islamic Iranian empires for more than a millennium, from around 600 BCE to 650 CE.  Zoroastrianism was suppressed from the 7th century onwards following the Muslim conquest of Persia of 633‚Äì654. In 2015, there were reports of up to 100,000 converts in Iraqi Kurdistan. Zoroastrianism has influenced the Second Temple Judaism, Gnosticism, Christianity, Islam, and Buddhism.

attributes.action: Only allow uni students to vote in their home town, not where they are studying.
attributes.background: Currently, university students can either vote in their uni town or home town and many choose the former. The huge density of students in certain areas now mean that students control the vote and their issues can dominate the political agenda and effectively disenfranchise the local community.
attributes.additional_details: This is not driven by anti-student sentiment but more through a sense of democracy. For example, if there was a General Election in their first week at uni, the student could vote in the uni town without any knowledge of local issues or the local MP. They will probably spend 27 months over 3 years at uni and yet a parliamentary term is 60 months, so their vote affects the area long after they've left! They can also vote in local elections, on local issues from Day 1.

attributes.action: Scrap smart motorways and bring back the safety of the hard shoulder.
attributes.background: When your vehicle has issues on a motorway, you look for the safety of the hard shoulder. Smart motorways have removed this and are not smart enough to recognise lane 1 blockages quick enough. As a consequence, lives are put at imminent risk.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the implementation of motorways, there has always been a hard shoulder which served several purposes. It is a safe zone for a vehicle to use if there's a mechanical problem, if there is a sudden emergency and more so, it was a clear lane for emergency services to use. 

Since the implementation of smart motorways, this lane has become a live lane and if the unforseen happens, you are stranded in what is now a death trap and also delaying emergency vehicles attending an incident.

attributes.action: DEFRA support Farmers Transitioning to Arable Farming
attributes.background: To help and support Farmers Transitioning from Animal Agriculture to Arable Farming

attributes.action: Stop the deportation of Afghans
attributes.background:
Many Afghans deported risk either being killed or never being able to start a life again. Some have been killed. A country at war for the last 40 years cannot promise anything, let alone the beginning of a new life.
Please help us get 100,000 signatures and stop the deportations.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/zainadin-fazlie-deport-home-office-taliban-afghanistan-shot-dead-refugee-a8536736.html

attributes.action: Set up a Select Committee for Adults with Learning Disabilities.
attributes.background: The working practice of services regarding adults with learning disabilities need investigating root to branch inside and out by a specially appointed Select Committee.
attributes.additional_details: Not fit for purpose the Parliamentary Health & Social Care Ombudsman,  Local Government Ombudsman, UNISON and others fail to provide a service and/or adequate standard of service to deal with Adults with Learning  Disabilities.

attributes.action: Ban schools from supplying milk cartons with plastic straws.
attributes.background: Eco teams from two primary schools in the North West are collaborating to ban plastic straws from school milk after learning about the damage they are causing to our wildlife and habitats.
attributes.additional_details: The children estimate that 1.7 million children have milk each day in Key Stage 1, so approximately 8.5 million straws are discarded each week.  The Government must ban schools from giving children milk with plastic straws, ban local authorities from buying milk with plastic straws, and ensure that all milk supplied to schools meets minimum Eco standards so that no unnecessary plastic, like straws, are used in manufacturing or packaging.

attributes.action: Stop unregulated animal ‚Äúrescues‚Äù bringing animals into the UK
attributes.background: Many ‚Äúrescues‚Äù bringing dogs into the UK are un-regulated businesses disguised as ‚Äúrescues‚Äù. Only registered animal charities should be allowed to bring dogs into the UK. It should be an offence for unregistered ‚Äúrescues‚Äù to bring dogs into the UK for sale or adoption.
attributes.additional_details: They can cause dire cruelty to dogs. No regulation means cash in hand. No help is given when dogs are homed. Dogs are un-assessed, homes are un-checked & NO rescue back up is given to help. These people are just dog SELLERS. ‚ÄòDonations‚Äô & ‚Äòadoption fees‚Äô for dogs go straight into their pockets. The fundraising is also a scam!

attributes.action: Extra teaching staff in Primary Schools to support children with Dyslexia.
attributes.background: My 8yrs old son has been screened at his school for Dyslexia&he is classed as severe. The school support my son as much as they can but any specific teaching support for the condition will start when he attends secondary school. This is wrong primary level is when help/support will make a difference

attributes.action: Create a national campaign to raise awareness of the symptoms of Type 1 diabetes
attributes.background:
Type 1 diabetes is an autoimmune condition which can not be prevented and currently can not be cured. It is an unrelenting condition that affects every aspect of life both physically & mentally.
Awareness of the symptoms is low and children are dying due to late / missed diagnosis.
attributes.additional_details:
In the uk there are approximately 400,000 people living with type 1 diabetes with 29,000 of them being children. This number is increasing by 4% each year. Over the last 20 years there has been a 5% increase each year in the under 5s age group!! (stats from JDRF website)
I have four children, two of which have Type 1 diabetes. We were lucky we knew the signs, others are not so lucky.
We have had a national awareness campaign for meningitis & sepsis, we need one for Type 1 diabetes.

attributes.action: Require the prominent labelling of palm oil on all products sold in the UK
attributes.background: Palm oil plantations are a major reason of huge tracts of rainforest destroyed every day. Endangered species are being pushed towards extinction. Companies know that Palm oil is becoming well known as a problem ingredient and hide the product under dozens of different names making it hard to avoid.
attributes.additional_details: www.travelfordifference.com/list-palm-oil-free-products/

attributes.action: Require large employers to publish their parental leave and pay policies
attributes.background: There is already a requirement that companies have such policies (which may match the statutory minimum). However, this information is not generally publicly available and often is not shared with potential employees. Sadly, individuals risk discrimination if they ask for it.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2014 Glassdoor found that 78% of women would not ask about maternity policies at interview, and only 1/3 of them received this information in induction packs. Yet salary, holiday, pension entitlements and health insurance are all routinely discussed at the point of hiring.

These policies could be included with gender pay gap reporting for large companies. This would be logistically easy for companies to do. We call upon the government to adopt this position.

attributes.action: Stop the tax payer funding Royal weddings.
attributes.background: Stop the tax payer funding royal weddings including the upcoming wedding. The Government needs to advise the Queen of the public outrage at this disgraceful waste of public money. The Royal Family have more than enough tax payer money to fund this flamboyant wedding themselves.
attributes.additional_details: At a time of public funding cuts to libraries, roads maintenance, police service and other publicly funding bodies it is a disgrace that the Government is even considering funding this wedding.

attributes.action: Grant Bees legal protection under The Animal Welfare Act 2006.
attributes.background: We have over 250 species of Bee in the UK, all playing a role in our eco-system, food chain and agricultural success. Since the 1980's the Bee population has declined, which, if left to continue will have an untold impact on the mental, physical and economical welfare of everyone in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Under the Animal Welfare Act 2006 an animal is only granted legal protection if it is a Vertebrate. This leaves Bees with very little in the way of physical or environmental protection.
Classing Bees as a species to be protected under the AWA 2006, means better action against those who threaten the population, whether they be individuals or industries, in the long term providing a better quality of life for us as a species, as well as the numerous native species we share our country with.

attributes.action:
Justice for cats
Make it law to report hitting a cat
attributes.background: I lost my cat a few years ago to a taxi car speeding down my road my road s a no through road)  he new he had hit her but carried on to collect his ride. On the way back acknowledging he knew he hit her and left the seen. If she was a dog she would have had rights but cats don‚Äôt. Justice for cats.
attributes.additional_details: I love my cats as much as I loved my dog.

attributes.action: Introduce licence to practice for car mechanics
attributes.background: Anyone can open a motor garage and start working on any vehicles without proper prior knowledge or training. It is now time to deter rogue mechanics to carry out work on motor vehicles without having a licence first. The government should establish a regulatory body for motor mechanics

attributes.action: Same sex unmarried/civil partnered parents to be on Childs birth certificate
attributes.background: In the UK same sex parents of donor children are unable to both go on their childs birth certificate - unless they are married/ civil partnered preconception or the child was conceived through the help of a registered fertility clinic. My son has only me on his birth certificate and it's wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
Why is it ok for heterosexual couples to both be registered on birth certificate, some of these Fathers registered are not even the biological Fathers and no questions asked.

If anything were to happen to me my son would be an orphan due to no other parent having rights over him.

As a nation we have come so far with equality and rights, however the legislation and laws need to be updated to reflect this.

attributes.action: Official apology to the Polish nation for UK actions at the Yalta conference
attributes.background: The apology should recognise British's abandonment of the Polish nation and 200,000 troops of the Polish Armed Forces serving under the high command of the British Army during the conference in Yalta. The UK left Poland and Poles to the grip of Soviet tyranny.
attributes.additional_details: The United Kingdom failed to meet their diplomatic, military and moral obligations with respect to the Polish nation during the prelude to and aftermath of WWII. At Yalta, Churchill agreed that Stalin should keep the Soviet gains in Poland and that tens of thousands of veteran Polish troops under British command should lose their Kresy homes to the Soviet Union. In reaction, thirty officers and men from the II Corps committed suicide. Only 25 MPs at that time voted against Churchill plan!

attributes.action: Give people accused of sexual offences anonymity until charge.
attributes.background: No one suggests names should never be released. What I believe is that there is a correct time to release names and that is not before a person is charged with an offence.

attributes.action: Do not rename the Second Severn Crossing as 'The Prince Of Wales Bridge'.
attributes.background: Many are unhappy that the bridge is to be named after The Prince Of Wales. This decision was made without any consultation with the Welsh people. A name of real significance to the Welsh should be chosen.

attributes.action: To create awareness amongst children/teenagers about Autism/Aspergers in schools
attributes.background: I would like the government make this a small part of personal studies in schools to give children/teenagers an understanding about children living with Autism/Aspergers in social situations. It will help them to be able to recognize behavior traits and actions in order to understand.
attributes.additional_details:
A small part of the curriculum would help so many children with Autism/Aspergers be able to feel comfortable in social situations such as playing, school and parties without being judged, bullied or name called. 
Being able to integrate into social situations is key but not easy for children living with these conditions. 
Ways of communicating and showing emotion are very different from child to child but can be seen as behavior problems if not understood. 
All children deserve to happy & secure

attributes.action: Life sentence for causing death by dangerous driving, including first offences
attributes.background: July 1st 2017 was the day my 17 year old brother, Stephen, was killed due to dangerous driving. The driver was on multiple drugs as well as being fuelled with alcohol. The car they had was not theirs, they had no insurance, no tax and no licence! They also seriously injured a young girl.
attributes.additional_details: The offender was not sentenced until 9 months after Stephen‚Äôs death. During this time we didn‚Äôt see the offender show any remorse. They appeared to be out partying, drinking and taking drugs. The offender was sentenced to just 8 years in prison and because they pleaded guilty, they got a third knocked off this sentence and because it was a first offence the sentence will be reduced by further third.

attributes.action: Expand driving penalties to include the charge vehicular manslaughter
attributes.background: I think that the increase in dangerous, reckless and careless driving needs to be properly addressed. In the wrong hands a car is as lethal as a loaded gun. Death should be charged as vehicular manslaughter and life changing injuries as attempted vehicular manslaughter.
attributes.additional_details: Although courts now have to power to sentence those who cause death by dangerous driving to 14 years to life, this penalty is rarely, if ever used. I feel that if the charge included the term manslaughter, not only would the perception of motorists change, but judges would be more inclined to sentence those who have caused death or life changing injuries, whilst driving at excessive speed, whilst using a mobile device, under the influence of drink/drugs to an appropriate custodial sentence.

attributes.action: Make Daventry District Council (DDC) into a Unitary Authority
attributes.background: Under the proposed arrangements, decisions in the District will be taken by a council of which a majority of members represent the urban areas of Northampton. Let DDC become a unitary authority: keep democracy local.

attributes.action: We call on the government to fund a new NHS A&E Hospital for West Herts NOW.
attributes.background: NHS Improvement and DHSC have reviewed West Herts Hospital Trust's Strategic Outline Case for hospital redevelopment and advised them to come up with a more affordable scheme whilst admitting the Trust's hospital buildings need improving, particularly those at Vicarage Road.(a slight understatement)
attributes.additional_details: WHHT admit that it would take at least ¬£600 million to redevelop Watford General Hospital-The Queen Elizabeth Hospital, Birmingham was built for ¬£545 million and has twice the number of beds! Major redevelopment of West Herts' hospitals would not only take more than a decade to complete but incur considerable inconvenience and disruption and not be the best long-term solution. (WH's pop. expected to grow by 150 000 in the next 15 years)  NOW IS THE TIME TO FUND A NEW A&E HOSPITAL FOR WEST HERTS.
